name: Blobcano
description:
In Blobcano, you are a blob in a volcanic arena. The floor is lava and rocks fall from the sky. By grappling between rocks and punching your opponents, you fight to be the last blob standing!

This project was completed as my Senior year, capstone project with a team of seven developers. Below is the list of team members and their contributions.

Luke Lohden: Production
- Organized production schedule
- Defined tasks and deliverables
- Established meeting schedule and agendas
- Lead discussions on game design and direction
- Organized team input into development plan
- Managed project scope
- Designed & created user interface
- Designed control scheme
- Worked with the team artists, programmers, and audio to guide process
- Integrated work of artists, programmers, and audio into efficient workflow

Adi Iyer: Audio
- Recorded foley sound effects
- Recorded voice lines and announcements
- Composed scores for levels and main menu
- Programmed Audio events and triggers in unity
- Created audio mixer for sound control in game

Matt Nguyen: Art
- Character concept art and design
- Character animations
- Character facial expressions
- Background art for title screen and early level background
- Assets for rocks, lava, barriers, and other game objects
- Assisted in dynamic lighting and bump-mapping sprites

Tori Serrano: Art
- Arena background art

Quinn Levine: Programming
- Support for multiple controllers
- Scripted Main Menu and lobby UI behavior
- Organized and executed playtesting
- Created player AI

Jeffrey Araki: Programming
- Programmed particle systems
- Created alternate gamemodes (king of the hill, training)
- Scripted in-game UI behavior
- Programmed rock spawn generation
- Created game loop and coded gameplay objectives

Brad Geurrero: Programming
- Level lighting, bump map materials.

- Combat code that controlled punching / swiping
- Grapple and punch reticles
- Camera movement
- Cross platform input via XInput (Windows) and Unity input (Mac)
